data.title: Over rated
data.text:
When we first walked in, it wasn't clear if the hostess was ready to seat us or not.  That started off very confusing, but she was friendly.  My wife and I ordered Lasagna Rolls, a side of Alfredo sauce for the bread, and a garlic shrimp in cream sauce. The Lasagna rolls were visibly overcooked and difficult to eat.  The flavor inside was good.  Maybe overcooked is the way it is served, but if the cook didn't catch it, you would have thought the server would.  
The Alfredo sauce was also overcooked and the parmesan was grainy within the sauce.  It was all settled on the bottom of the bowl.  I almost said something, but we decided to let it go.  
The pasta was really the best part of the meal.  It was cooked well and the presentation was good.  The server asked us if we wanted parmesan on the pasta.  I thought that she would grate it on like you normally see, however it was just dropped off in a dish.
For just two of us splitting an appetizer, salad and a meal, the bill came up to $50.  It is definitely over priced and would keep us from coming back.  There is no way we could afford to take a family of 4, unless we take out a second mortgage.

data.title: Best Italian In Indy
data.text: A MUST STOP each time we are in Indy. Amazing freshly prepared Italian food in a great casual atmosphere. The staff are amazing and flexible to make your meal truly a dining experience. Great with the kids too. Oh and did I mention the tiramisu. It's to die for.

data.title: Delicious, Authentic Italian Food in the heart of the Arts&Design District!
data.text: Love, love, love Donatello's! Enjoy delicious, authentic Italian fare in this charming, locally owned restaurant. Donatello's has a full bar, nice beer and wine selections and delicious dinners! I highly recommend the bruschetta or calamari for starters and you'll never go wrong with any of Beth's famous homemade desserts!

data.title: Perfect private dinner
data.text: We celebrated my father's 80th birthday with 20 of our family members.  The staff of Donatello's made the evening one to remember.  Their private room is the best spot for a group dinner in Carmel.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text:
We were a group of 8. Made reservations and our table was ready, it was a Thursday evening, but place was relatively empty. The waitress was trying to be friendly, but she was curt and loud. Service was slow, and they had to ask everyone what they ordered. Food was ok, but nothing special. Four of our group had veal, I had the ravioli, one had pizza, and one had shrimp. No one raved about the meal. It was expensive considering the meal and atmosphere. My ravioli was 15, salad extra, my husband meal was 23, we had wine and our bill was well over a hundred dollars. 

We would not go back, our group eats out a lot this was one was disappointing.

data.title: I don't understand why this restaurant is surviving, disappointment served again.
data.text:
The place is average.  Average wait staff, and definitely average food.  I would say maybe below average in creativity when it comes to food items offered.  Went with my sister because I was given a gift certificate, I would not want to spend my money in the place.
We both got salmon, which was cooked very nicely, but everything about the service and the menu was nothing more than what I make at home.  The seasoning is nonexistent; if they would just salt and pepper anything they serve, it would give a pop to the flavor.  The sides are ok, not great, not bad.  
I can only deduce that people who live in this area are so busy or not good at cooking themselves, or have money to waste that they go to this place.  I prefer a more authentic Italian experience if I am going to pay for my dinner.

data.title: Best Cannoli
data.text: We came here for the first time.  We were here on a Thursday evening and had excellent service.  There were two that kept our drinks filled and served our dinner.  I had the Nordic smoked Salmon fettuccini that was a special they are thinking of adding to the menu.  It was very good and came with soup or salad.  I had the minestrone soup which was not strong on flavor.  It did have lots of vegetables in it.  My wife had the chicken Fettuccine which she said was really good.  She said the chicken had a really good flavor.  For desert we shared a chocolate chip cannoli which is the best we've had around here. It compared to the ones we had last year in Sicily and Italy.

data.title: Excellent Italian food - family owned
data.text: The restaurant is cozy and staff very friendly and accommodating.  Being a vegetarian, often your choices are limited but not here as they accommodated my requests to meet my needs. The food is excellent. I love the mushroom risotto. I've brought many friends and family here. Everyone says it is their favorite Italian restaurant in town.

data.title: Wonderful Italian!
data.text: I ate there for the first time last evening and was impressed with both the quality of the food and the service. Great experience!

data.title: Disappointing Quality
data.text: Recently had dinner at Donatello's and were completely disappointed.  We have been patronizing this restaurant since they opened a number of years ago, and have always been happy with the food and service.  Our waitress was pleasant enough and tried her best, but the quality of the food was less than satisfactory.  The calamari was the equivalent of chicken nuggets--ground and formed into French fry like sticks.  No olive oil or grated Parmesan cheese was on the table or offered, a sloppy omission in an Italian restaurant.  The tomato sauce on the Chilean sea bass was bland & tasted like it came straight out of a can as did the gorgonzola cream sauce on the ravioli.  We have patronized the owners businesses both here and in their former iteration at another location for years, and it appears that they no longer care about offering a good quality product. They know how to do it right, but have chosen to take short cuts in quality and presentation.

data.title: Acceptable Italian Food. Outstanding Tiramisu!
data.text: Donatello's is an average Italian restaurant.  Servers are friendly depending on who you get.  The food is average but better than Olive garden (and better ingredients!).  The pasta is acceptable and the Chicken Parmesan uses a very large chicken breast.  This is much better than most low to mid range Italian restaurants.  The best item on the menu and makes this place stand out is its Tiramisu.  I travel the world and it by far is my favorite.  They use condensed milk blended into the custard that gives it a unique flavor and texture.  My family and I go here maybe once every couple months.  Set you expectations right and you will have an enjoyable meal.

data.title: Great Italian in a relaxed atmosphere!
data.text: We ate there twice this week, and enjoyed our dinners both nights. He service was good, the atmosphere casual, and the food was excellent. The wine list is quite small, but okay for a casual Italian dinner. A great place to go after work and enjoy a nice dinner, and sit outside and enjoy the people in downtown Carmel.

data.title: I wanted to like this place
data.text: Our party arrived early and left late -- sounds like a great evening,yes? Took well over an hour for entrees to arrive. The fried ravioli was great, but the entrees were just so so. Bland, under seasoned. I could taste the flour in the sauce, which told me it was undercooked. The server offered to fix it,  but. after such a long wait, I refused her offer. The servers told us that they had not planned on being so busy; there were no reservations, so they were understaffed. They did comp our group several desserts, but I still find it reprehensible that we had to wait so long for our meals when folks who came in well after us were served and had paid before we got our meals. To be on the safe side, make reservations.

data.title: Restuarant in Carmel IN
data.text: This was our first visit to Donatello's.  We had a group of 6 and we're actually the first group to arrive around 6 PM.  We got our drinks fairly quick, then another hour before we got all of our appetizers.  After we had been there for 1 1/2 hours , watching several other tables get their food and pay their bills, we questioned the staff about the slowness of our food.  They gave us the excuse that they didn't expect as much business and they were under staffed. Once our food finally arrived, it was just OK.   The wine was pretty good and they gave us three desserts to comp for the poor service. We have eaten in much better Italian restuarants.

data.title: Great Italian
data.text: We love Donatello's! They have great regional Italian. There is no favorite because every dish I have ever had there has been perfect, no really! I grew up eating on the Hill in St. Louis, so I am an Italian restaurant snob. The dishes are authentic. Really. The pasta dishes are full of flavor. The entrees are delicious. Start with the ravioli gorgonzola. That dish alone would make a meal, so share so you have room. End with the Italian Cream Cake (yes, all capitalized, its that good) from the family recipe. No more writing for me...I have to head out to Donatello's. See you there.

data.title: Definitely worth it!
data.text: We did Donatello's for a mother's day dinner and wish we'd have tried it long ago! The menu is good, and they have lots of specials. The house gorganzola dressing is incredible. More than one of us had the special manicotti and it was delicious! We are partial to another local place but Donatello's manicotti could give it serious competition. Huge portions too and filled with delicious cheese. Definitely a return to place. The owner had just made Italian cream cake and despite having dessert waiting for us at home we got two pieces to go because it sounded so good. And man was it! The non pasta lover in the group hot the pizza and had only good things to say about it. My only "complaint" was that they kind of rushed us, but I do t think they were intending to push us out as much as just being too attentive. Great food!

data.title: Nice quaint place!
data.text: We made reservations for four on a Saturday night.  It is located right on Main Street and in the perfect location of Carmel.  The menu was pretty good, but missing a few of my favorites.  Overall the service was good and we enjoyed our meal.  It's not the best Italian restaurant in town, but it was worth trying.

data.title: A good dinner in Carmel
data.text: Donatello's has expanded, so there is plenty of room to get a table, which used to be an issue.  The food is very solid.  It is a nice place to go with friends in downtown Carmel.  Not too fancy, not too expensive, just good food for a good price.

data.title: Good food, slow terrible service
data.text: This was our first time visiting this restaurant. We had a group of 6. It was our monthly couples dinner out. We were seated right away. Our orders were taken. We received the soups and salads. These dishes were cleared and we expected our dinners to follow.  And then nothing. This is where the service ended.  Our dinners did not come out for 1 1/2 hours. Seriously. An hour and a half. We had to keep asking for drink refills.  We requested our meals from the waiter but nothing.  The meals finally came out 1 1/2 hours later. Food was good but not worth the wait. The waiter finally apologized and provided desserts on the house. Too many decent restaurants with better service to deal with this kind of service again.

data.title: Good food and menu,
data.text:
Donatello's has expanded it's seating over the last few years and they have a few tables outside now as well.  IT is located on the Main St. of downtown Carmel, IN.  The decor is done in an industrial theme in red and black.  It does have white tablecloths, but it is fine to wear jeans.  
The menu has a good variety of different items, and there is plenty to order if you don't want pasta.  My husband had the special which was a poached Salmon with a lemon caper sauce, side vegetables, which he did like, however was average.  
A BORING iceberg diner salad came first.  The salad ($4.00) consisted of chopped iceberg lettuce, two wedges of tomato, a cucumber slice and two thick large pieces of red onion.  The plate was cold which indicated these salads had been sitting in the refrigerator.  I would not pay again for the dinner salad, nor would I even bother having it served to me again for free....nothing different than what you would get in a cheap diner. The salad dressing tasted like it was out of a bottle.  The bread was awful, white bread that comes out of the tube in the cold section of the grocery, presliced and then baked....no flavor, it was disappointing....it seems that with salad and bread they are really cutting corners trying to save a few dollars.  Neither one are worth even tasting.
I had the tortellini with pink sauce.  It had bacon in the sauce, it was good, but the onion was not chopped well and was in large hunks, which seemed unusual.   None of the pastas are homemade,  but it was cooked well.  Dessert was excellent.  I had what they called an "Italian" white cake with a coconut cream cheese frosting.  It was excellent, but made me wonder why the bread was so bad, since they bake the cake there at the restaurant.  
The service was average to good.  They were overly anxious to clear dishes, even though we weren't done eating.  I am not sure about the week days, but on a Friday evening we needed reservations and we were there early (6pm)  Even though we had made reservations early in the day they lead us to a table (many other empty tables) that was facing directly into the kitchen.  It was as though we were eating right there in the kitchen and extremely noisy  We asked to be moved which they did do.  
To summarize the main dishes and dessert were good but the salad and bread was very disappointing.
